turns.content: who is the author of the science book experiments and observations on electricity published in 1751

The book "Experiments and Observations on Electricity" was written by Benjamin Franklin. It was published in 1751 and is considered one of the key works in the early history of electricity. Franklin's book contains a series of experiments and observations that he conducted on electricity, as well as descriptions of his theories about the nature of electricity. The book helped establish Franklin as one of the leading figures in the study of electricity and laid the foundation for many of the principles that are still used in the field today.
